unnormalised: For your trip to Rajasthan, remember to budget not just for the flight tickets, which can easily be ₹15000 return from Mumbai, but also for accommodation. Decent hotels in Jaipur will cost you around Rs. 2500/night. Don't forget daily expenses! Food could be ₹800 per day, and travel within the city, say autos and taxis, might add another ₹500. Entry fees to forts and palaces can be steep – expect to pay Rs 2000 total for all the major attractions. So, for a 3-day trip, a rough estimate would be ₹15000 (flights) + ₹7500 (hotel) + ₹3900 (food and local travel) + Rs 2000 (entry fees), totaling around ₹28400. Factor in an extra 10% for unexpected expenses.
normalised: For your trip to Rajasthan, remember to budget not just for the flight tickets, which can easily be rupee fifteen thousand return from Mumbai, but also for accommodation. Decent hotels in Jaipur will cost you around rupees two thousand five hundred per night. Don't forget daily expenses! Food could be rupee eight hundred per day, and travel within the city, say autos and taxis, might add another rupee five hundred. Entry fees to forts and palaces can be steep – expect to pay rupees two thousand total for all the major attractions. So, for a three day trip, a rough estimate would be rupee fifteen thousand (flights) plus rupee seven thousand five hundred (hotel) plus rupee three thousand nine hundred (food and local travel) plus rupees two thousand (entry fees), totaling around rupee twenty eight thousand four hundred. Factor in an extra ten percent for unexpected expenses.
